unnormalised: **Mental Health Apps: Are they really helping or just another distraction?**
normalised: **Mental Health Apps: Are they really helping or just another distraction?**

unnormalised: So, lately I've been seeing *so* many ads for mental health apps. From meditation guides to mood trackers, they seem to promise the moon. As someone trying to navigate the daily grind in Mumbai, managing work, family, and the infamous traffic, I’m definitely intrigued.
normalised: So, lately I've been seeing *so* many ads for mental health apps. From meditation guides to mood trackers, they seem to promise the moon. As someone trying to navigate the daily grind in Mumbai, managing work, family, and the infamous traffic, I’m definitely intrigued.

unnormalised: But are they actually helpful? I mean, scrolling through another screen while feeling anxious feels kinda counterproductive, right? My friend, Priya, swears by one app for guided meditation, says it helps her before her crazy project deadlines at IIT Bombay. On the other hand, my cousin, Rahul, found them overwhelming. Too much information, too many notifications. He prefers talking to Dr. Sharma at AIIMS, even if it takes ages to get an appointment.

unnormalised: Has anyone else tried these apps? Any recommendations that actually work, especially for dealing with stress in a fast-paced Indian setting? My current apartment is only 600 sq ft, so I definitely need mental space more than physical!
